message.content: {"id": "16938", "title": "Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally", "description": "20020521 (F1)(This may not be a debug PRI wasn't sure). So the workaround, if the user wants to scroll through the Class File editor, is to always use the thumb.", "OB": "When a breakpoint is put in a Java file, right before a System.out.println statement, and the debug process is stepped into the println call (note that it may go into StringBuffer first, but that is not relevant), a Class File Editor opens. Clicking on the scrollbar's down arrow should scroll the editor, but it only scrolls one pixel at a time. Clicking on the scrollbar's background should scroll a page at a time, but it only scrolls about a line at a time. Grabbing the thumb and scrolling with that works well.", "EB": "The Class File Editor should scroll more naturally. When clicking on the arrows of the scrollbar, it should scroll one line at a time. Clicking on the scrollbar's background should scroll a page at a time. Currently, it only scrolls about a line at a time. However, grabbing the thumb and scrolling with that works well.", "SR": "Modify the Class File Editor to enable scrolling one line at a time when clicking on the arrows of the scrollbar, and scrolling a page at a time when clicking on the scrollbar's background."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '16938', 'title': 'Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally', 'description': "20020521 (F1)(This may not be a debug PRI wasn't sure). So the workaround, ifthe user wants to scroll through the Class File editor, is to always use thethumb. ", 'OB': "put a breakpoint in a java file, right before a System.out.println statement debug to the breakpoint step in to the println call (I happened to go in to StringBuffer firstallthat matters is that you do not have the source for the class you just steppedinto) a Class File Editor opens click on the scrollbar's down arrowProblem: the editor only scrolls one pixel at a time. click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a timeProblem: the editor only scrolls about a line at a time when it should bescrolling a page at a time.Grabbing the thumb and scrolling with that works well. ", 'EB': "Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally It should scroll one lineat a time when you click on the arrows. click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a timeProblem: the editor only scrolls about a line at a time when it should bescrolling a page at a time.Grabbing the thumb and scrolling with that works well. ", 'SR': ''}
